results.title: Le Dossier Francoise Muller = the Francoise Muller Case
results.brief_description:
Following an apparence on a TV show, economist Gerard Plantier is murdered in the underground garage of his appartment building. The only witnesses are his girlfriend, Francoise, and the night watchman. As the investigation progresses, it is revealed that Francoise had a rather shady past and that some of her former acquaintances may have something to do with Gerard’s death. To Judge Massot’s surprise, Francoise is doing her best to attract all the blame for the murder to herself.

Credits: Producer, Jean Gauthier ; director, Edouard Molinaro ; writer, Alphonse Boudard ; photography, Alain Levent ; music, Vladimir Cosma.
Cast: Simone Signoret, Michel Vitold, Jean-Claude Dauphin, Didier Haudepin, Bernard Pivot, Albert Simonin, Nathalie Delon, Jean-Pierre Darras, Andre Pousse, Saddy Rebbot, Katy Amaizo, Germaine Delbat, Andre Lacombe, Henry Rellys.

results.brief_description:
A couple running a grocery store is found murdered. The prime suspect is their own son, Jean-Michel, a brilliant student. When Elizabeth Massot meets the young man, she becomes intrigued by the relationship he had with his parents and starts drawing parallels between Jean-Michel’s situation and her own volatile relationship with son Guillaume.

Credits: Producer, Jean Gauthier ; director, Claude Chabrol ; writers, Claude Chabrol, Odile Barsky ; photography, Jean Rabier ; music, Pierre Jansen, Vladimir Cosma.
Cast: Simone Signoret, Didier Haudepin, Jean-Claude Dauphin, Michel Vitold, Bernadette Lafont, Mario David, Benoit Ferreux.

results.title: Un Innocent = an Innocent Man
results.brief_description:
Albert and Monique work in a plush hotel, respectively as night watchman and chambermaid. Monique is having an affair with Bob, the hotel barman. In order to finance their plan to elope to Biarritz and get rid of Albert, they set him up to burgle the room of one of the hotel guest. Albert is caught and the case is assigned to Judge Massot. During an interview with Judge Massot, Albert escapes and runs back home where he barricades himself with his children. As the police starts the siege of the house, Judge Massot decides to step in and talk Albert out of doing an even bigger mistake.

Credits: Producer, Jean Gauthier ; director, Nadine Trintigant ; writers, Patrick Modiano ; photography, William Lubtchansky ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Simone Signoret, Didier Haudepin, Jean-Claude Dauphin, Michel Vitold, Philippe Leotard, Juliet Berto, Etienne Chicot, Maurice Garrel, Pierre Vernier, Francois Perrot, Marie Trintignant.

results.title: The Michael Nyman songbook
results.creator_credit: Eberhard Junkersdorf, Bioskop Film, Decca, Hessischer rundfunk and Arte and Volker Schlondorff
results.brief_description: Michael Nyman conducts his own band and vocalist Ute Lemper in a program of popular songs of his own composition based on the texts of poet Paul Celan, Mozart, Rimbaud plus the piece entitled “Miranda” from the film “Prospero’s Books.” Recorded live at the Musikhalle, Hamburg, 1992.

results.title: The Dreaming
results.creator_credit: Mario Andreacchio, Wayne Groom, Craig Lahiff, Genesis Films, International Film Management and FGH Film Consortium
results.brief_description: Two hundred years ago bands of whalers roamed the oceans. In the Great Southern Land of Australia they discovered natives who cherished a mystical power called the Dreaming - a knowledge handed down from the beginning of their world. The whalers were bloodthirsty men, responsible for rapes killings and massacres - a taint upon the Dreaming. This taint lives on into the present and a new nightmare when a burial ground is unearthed, a girl dies, an ancient curse is revived and a young doctor becomes inextricably involved in a chain of supernatural events that point towards death. Starring Arthur Dignam, Penny Cook, Gary Sweet, Laurence Clifford and Kristina Nehm. Based on a story by Craig Lahiff and Terry Jennings.

results.title: Dances with wolves
results.creator_credit: Kevin Costner, Jim Wilson, Majestic Films International and TIG Productions
results.brief_description: Assigned to an abandoned army post, Civil War hero, John Dunbar (Kevin Costner) finds himself alone and beyond civilisation. Only a wolf and some roving Sioux Indians provide distractions. Curiosity and survival force Dunbar to overcome his fear and he develops a unique relationship with the Sioux. But as the US military ruthlessly pushes west, the Indians’ existence is threatened and Dunbar finds himself torn between two cultures. Honoured with seven Academy Awards including Best Picture (1991), this epic is a cinematic masterpiece of scope, beauty, spirituality and rousing adventure. Dean Semler’s photography is breathtaking. Screenplay by Michael Blake and based on his novel.

results.title: The Sheltering sky
results.creator_credit: Bernardo Bertolucci, Jeremy Thomas, TAO and Sahara
results.brief_description: The exotic, erotic, epic film version of Paul Bowles’ celebrated novel, brought to life by one of the great masters of modern cinema, Bernardo Bertolucci. This is the extraordinary story of a husband and wife desperate to rekindle passion in their lives; daring to cross the border into a world where jealousy has no place, where sensuality knows no limits and where every fantasy is brought to light. Their journey will take them far from the civilised world into disaster and despair. Stars Debra Winger and John Malkovich.

results.title: Last tango in Paris
results.creator_credit: Bernardo Bertolucci, Alberto Grimaldi, Les Productions Artistes and Produzioni Europee Associati
results.brief_description: From its opening image by English artist Francis Bacon of a disfigured, disintegrating man slumped in a chair to its tragic, ironic ending, “Last Tango in Paris” shatters the screen with its remarkable collision of talents and energies. Reaffirming why he is considered “the best film actor of all time” (Chicago Sun-Times), Marlon Brando portrays a man torn apart by the suicide of his wife. His attempt to bury his grief in a sudden, purely carnal relationship with a strange girl (Maria Schneider) only twists the emotional noose tighter. In examining basic, conflicting human drives, director Bernardo Bertolucci lays bare the primal nature of man as no film has done before. “Last Tango in Paris” stands as one of Bertolucci’s finest achievements. Academy Award Nominations: Best Actor - Marlon Brando, Best Director - Bernardo Bertolucci. Mostly French dialogue with English subtitles and some English dialogue.

results.title: The Fisher king
results.creator_credit: Terry Gilliam, Lynda Obst, Debra Hill and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: When a bigshot self-absorbed talkback radio host, Jack Lucas (Jeff Bridges), loses his job after a tragedy, he is plucked from disaster by the most improbable of saviours - a former history professor (Robin Williams), driven mad and onto the streets where he lives in a remarkable medieval world full of swords and sorcery, terrifying Red Knights and damsels in distress. This film serves grand lunacy and wisdom of the highest order with rare vision and style.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Terry Gilliam, Lynda Obst, Debra Hill and Tri-Star Pictures

results.title: How green was my valley
results.creator_credit: John Ford, Darryl F. Zanuck and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Winner of five Academy Awards, this is an inspiring yet heart-breaking film from producer Darryl Zanuck and director John Ford. Sixty year old Huw Morgan looks back on his life as a boy (Roddy McDowall) in a small Welsh mining town. His reminiscences reveal the disintegration of the closely knit Morgans, and his devoted parents (Donald Crisp, Sara Allgood), while capturing the sentiments and issues of their time. Maureen O’Hara and Walter Pidgeon co-star in this acclaimed classic, the story of one family’s dreams, struggles and triumphs. Based on the famous novel by Richard Llewellyn. Includes performances by the Welsh Singers.
